Prompts.Prompt: Researching factual information (e.g., “who was the first president of France?”, “how many countries use the euro?”)
Looking for current events or recent updates (e.g., “what’s going on in Canada today?”, “Search online”)
Looking for headlines (e.g., “any news on the wildfires?”, “what’s in today’s paper?”)
Technical help or anything related to coding, programming, or software (e.g., “what’s wrong with this Python code?”, “how to fix a null reference error?”)
Learning or trying to understand general concepts (e.g., “how does the stock market work?”, “what is entropy?”)
personnal conversation (e.g., “What is your name?”, “what is my name?”, “how old are you?”)
Casual conversation (e.g., “what's up?”, “how are you”, “let's talk'”)
User is refering to a past conversation (e.g., “What do you mean?”,  “What did we talk about?”)
User is not happy about a past conversation (e.g.,“That's not what I asked”, “Wrong!”)

ParsePromptInstructions: Which one of those affirmations represent best the user intent. Return 1 if affirmation one, 2 if affirmation two, 3 if affirmation three. Return only a number 1, 2 or 3 no explanation.
